verses.verse: I said <S%H559><s%> in my heart, <S%H3820><s%> "Come now, <S%H3212><s%> I will test <S%H5254><s%> you with mirth: <S%H8057><s%> therefore enjoy <S%H7200><s%> pleasure; <S%H2896><s%>" and behold, <S%H1892><s%> this also was vanity.
I said <S%H559><s%> of laughter, <S%H7814><s%> "It is foolishness; <S%H1984><s%>" and of mirth, <S%H8057><s%> "What <S%H2090><s%> does it accomplish? <S%H6213><s%>"

I searched <S%H8446><s%> in my heart <S%H3820><s%> how to cheer <S%H4900><s%> my <S%H1320><s%> flesh with wine, <S%H3196><s%> my heart <S%H3820><s%> yet guiding <S%H5090><s%> me with wisdom, <S%H2451><s%> and how to lay hold <S%H270><s%> of folly, <S%H5531><s%> until I might see <S%H7200><s%> what it was good <S%H2896><s%> for the sons <S%H1121><s%> of men <S%H120><s%> that they should do <S%H6213><s%> under heaven <S%H8064><s%> all <S%H4557><s%> the days <S%H3117><s%> of their lives. <S%H2416><s%>
I made myself great <S%H1431><s%> works. <S%H4639><s%> I built <S%H1129><s%> myself houses. <S%H1004><s%> I planted <S%H5193><s%> myself vineyards. <S%H3754><s%>
I made <S%H6213><s%> myself gardens <S%H1593><s%> and parks, <S%H6508><s%> and I planted <S%H5193><s%> trees <S%H6086><s%> in them of all kinds of fruit. <S%H6529><s%>
I made <S%H6213><s%> myself pools <S%H1295><s%> of water, <S%H4325><s%> to water <S%H8248><s%> from it the forest <S%H3293><s%> where trees <S%H3293><s%> were reared. <S%H6779><s%>

I bought <S%H7069><s%> male servants <S%H5650><s%> and female servants, <S%H8198><s%> and had servants born <S%H1121><s%> in my house. <S%H1004><s%> I also had great <S%H7235><s%> possessions <S%H4735><s%> of herds <S%H6629><s%> and flocks, <S%H1241><s%> above all who were before <S%H6440><s%> me in Jerusalem; <S%H3389><s%>

I also gathered <S%H3664><s%> silver <S%H3701><s%> and gold <S%H2091><s%> for myself, <S%H5459><s%> and the treasure of kings <S%H4428><s%> and of the provinces. <S%H4082><s%> I got <S%H6213><s%> myself male <S%H7891><s%> and female singers, <S%H7891><s%> and the delights <S%H8588><s%> of the sons <S%H1121><s%> of men <S%H120><s%>—musical instruments, <S%H7705><s%> and that of all sorts.
So I was great, <S%H1431><s%> and increased <S%H3254><s%> more than all who were before <S%H6440><s%> me in Jerusalem. <S%H3389><s%> My wisdom <S%H2451><s%> also remained with me. <S%H5975><s%>

Whatever my eyes <S%H5869><s%> desired, <S%H7592><s%> I didn't <S%H680><s%> keep from them. <S%H4513><s%> I didn't withhold my heart <S%H3820><s%> from any joy, <S%H8057><s%> for my heart <S%H3820><s%> rejoiced <S%H8056><s%> because of all my labor, <S%H5999><s%> and this was my portion <S%H2506><s%> from all my labor. <S%H5999><s%>

Then I looked <S%H6437><s%> at all the works <S%H4639><s%> that my hands <S%H3027><s%> had worked, <S%H6213><s%> and at the labor <S%H5999><s%> that I had labored <S%H5999><s%> to do; <S%H6213><s%> and behold, <S%H1892><s%> all was vanity and a chasing <S%H7469><s%> after wind, <S%H7307><s%> and there was no profit <S%H3504><s%> under the sun. <S%H8121><s%>

I turned <S%H6437><s%> myself to consider <S%H7200><s%> wisdom, <S%H2451><s%> madness, <S%H1947><s%> and folly: <S%H5531><s%> for what can the <S%H120><s%> king <S%H4428><s%>'s <S%H935><s%> successor <S%H310><s%> do? <S%H6213><s%> Just that which has been done long ago. <S%H3528><s%>
Then I saw <S%H7200><s%> that <S%H3426><s%> wisdom <S%H2451><s%> excels <S%H3504><s%> folly, <S%H5531><s%> as far as light <S%H216><s%> excels <S%H3504><s%> darkness. <S%H2822><s%>

The wise man <S%H2450><s%>'s eyes <S%H5869><s%> are in his head, <S%H7218><s%> and the fool <S%H3684><s%> walks <S%H1980><s%> in darkness <S%H2822><s%>—and yet I perceived <S%H3045><s%> that one <S%H259><s%> event <S%H4745><s%> happens to them all. <S%H7136><s%>

Then <S%H227><s%> I said <S%H559><s%> in my heart, <S%H3820><s%> "As it happens <S%H4745><s%> to the fool, <S%H3684><s%> so will it happen <S%H7136><s%> even to me; <S%H1571><s%> and why was I then more <S%H3148><s%> wise? <S%H2449><s%>" Then I said <S%H1696><s%> in my heart <S%H3820><s%> that this also is vanity. <S%H1892><s%>

For of the wise <S%H2450><s%> man, <S%H5973><s%> even as of the fool, <S%H3684><s%> there is no memory <S%H2146><s%> for ever, <S%H5769><s%> since <S%H3528><s%> in the days <S%H3117><s%> to come <S%H935><s%> all will have been long forgotten. <S%H7911><s%> Indeed, <S%H2450><s%> the wise man must die <S%H4191><s%> just like the fool! <S%H3684><s%>

So I hated <S%H8130><s%> life, <S%H2416><s%> because the work <S%H4639><s%> that is worked <S%H6213><s%> under the sun <S%H8121><s%> was grievous <S%H7451><s%> to me; <S%H1892><s%> for all is vanity and a chasing <S%H7469><s%> after wind. <S%H7307><s%>

I hated <S%H8130><s%> all my labor <S%H5999><s%> in which I labored <S%H5999><s%> under the sun, <S%H8121><s%> because I must leave <S%H3240><s%> it to the man <S%H120><s%> who comes after me. <S%H310><s%>

Who knows <S%H3045><s%> whether he will be a wise <S%H2450><s%> man or a fool? <S%H5530><s%> Yet he will have rule <S%H7980><s%> over all of my labor <S%H5999><s%> in which I have labored, <S%H5999><s%> and in which I have shown myself wise <S%H2449><s%> under the sun. <S%H8121><s%> This also is vanity. <S%H1892><s%>

Therefore I began <S%H5437><s%> to cause <S%H2976><s%> my heart <S%H3820><s%> to despair <S%H2976><s%> concerning all the labor <S%H5999><s%> in which I had labored <S%H5999><s%> under the sun. <S%H8121><s%>

For there is <S%H3426><s%> a man <S%H120><s%> whose labor <S%H5999><s%> is with wisdom, <S%H2451><s%> with knowledge, <S%H1847><s%> and with skillfulness; <S%H5998><s%> yet he shall leave <S%H5414><s%> it for his portion <S%H2506><s%> to a man <S%H120><s%> who has not labored <S%H5998><s%> for it. <S%H1892><s%> This also is vanity and a great <S%H7227><s%> evil. <S%H7451><s%>

For what has <S%H1933><s%> a man <S%H120><s%> of all his labor, <S%H5999><s%> and of the striving <S%H7475><s%> of his heart, <S%H3820><s%> in which <S%H1931><s%> he labors <S%H6001><s%> under the sun? <S%H8121><s%>

For all his days <S%H3117><s%> are sorrows, <S%H4341><s%> and his travail <S%H6045><s%> is grief; <S%H3708><s%> yes, <S%H3915><s%> even in the night his heart <S%H3820><s%> takes no rest. <S%H7901><s%> This also is vanity. <S%H1892><s%>

There is nothing better <S%H2896><s%> for a man <S%H120><s%> than that he should eat <S%H398><s%> and drink, <S%H8354><s%> and make his soul <S%H5315><s%> enjoy <S%H7200><s%> good <S%H2896><s%> in his labor. <S%H5999><s%> This <S%H2090><s%> also I saw, <S%H7200><s%> that it is from the hand <S%H3027><s%> of God. <S%H430><s%>
For who can eat, <S%H398><s%> or who can have enjoyment, <S%H2363><s%> more than I? <S%H2351><s%>

For to the man <S%H120><s%> who pleases <S%H2896><s%> him, <S%H6440><s%> God gives <S%H5414><s%> wisdom, <S%H2451><s%> knowledge, <S%H1847><s%> and joy; <S%H8057><s%> but to the sinner <S%H2398><s%> he gives <S%H5414><s%> travail, <S%H6045><s%> to gather <S%H622><s%> and to heap up, <S%H3664><s%> that he may give <S%H5414><s%> to him who <S%H6440><s%> pleases <S%H2896><s%> God. <S%H430><s%> This also is vanity <S%H1892><s%> and a chasing <S%H7469><s%> after wind. <S%H7307><s%>
